Source

Class TrapCell

  • java.lang.Object
    • Source.Cell
      • Source.TrapCell
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CellInterface

    public class TrapCell
extends Cell
    A TrapCell keeps the player until the next event.

    A TrapCell has no particular field, excepted those of its mother (Cell).

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Leo JUMEL et Brice NUZZO

      TrapCell(int idx)
      TrapCell constructor A TrapCell is built with an index.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canBeLeftNow()
      Indicates if a player occupying this cell can, at this turn, leave the cell.
      boolean isRetaining()
      Indicates if a cell holds a player until another player reaches the same cell.

    • Method Detail

      • canBeLeftNow

        public boolean canBeLeftNow()
        Indicates if a player occupying this cell can, at this turn, leave the cell.
        Specified by:
        canBeLeftNow in interface CellInterface
        Overrides:
        canBeLeftNow in class Cell
        Returns:
        true if and only if the player in this cell can freely leaves the cell at this turn

      • isRetaining

        public boolean isRetaining()
        Indicates if a cell holds a player until another player reaches the same cell.
        Specified by:
        isRetaining in interface CellInterface
        Overrides:
        isRetaining in class Cell
        Returns:
        true if and only if the only way for a player to get out of this cell is for another player to replace him
